abstract:
We will walk through a high level introduction to Docker and work
through two use cases focused on reproducibility and model deployment.
Working Docker files and python code will be provided. In this tutorial
we will cover:

-  Benefits of using Docker as part of your workflow.
-  Anatomy of a Docker file.
-  Containers and registries: build a Docker container, push and pull
   from DockerHub.
-  How to set up your development environment on any machine using
   Docker.
-  How to deploy a simple sklearn model using flask and Docker.

Attendees will need: Docker, git.

Please install both docker and git prior to the tutorial.
description:
This tutorial will introduce the basics of working with Docker
containers and walk through common use cases. Using Docker containers,
data scientists can create reproducible work flows and ease model
deployment.
title: Docker for Data Science: Reproducibility and Deployment
